page.title: 19Farming
page.content: Farming is the main industry in this area.The size of the farms vary from under 40 acres to over 450 acres. Sheep farming is the main concern and on the largest farms flocks of 300 to 400 sheep increase to over 700 in the lambing season. A secondary line is calf rearing and therefore most of the land is pasture to provide grazing for these two lines. There is not a great deal of dairy farming since one of the largest farms,Norton Court,sold all their dairy herd and milking machinery in June 1985. Crops grown are maize,wheat,barley and sugar beet. White House Farm has 50 acres of blackcurrant bushes which yield 100 to 140 tons of fruit.These go to Beechams at Coleford for Ribena.The farm's cider apples go to Bulmers of Hereford
